thread.title: Blogger Cyprian Nyakundi sentenced in Collymore defamation suit - Nairobi News
thread.title_full: Blogger Cyprian Nyakundi sentenced in Collymore defamation suit - Nairobi News

title: Blogger Cyprian Nyakundi sentenced in Collymore defamation suit - Nairobi News
text:
Blogger Cyprian Nyakundi sentenced in Collymore defamation suit Posted on Mar 20, 2017 113 Views LEFT: Blogger Cyprian Nyakundi. RIGHT: Safaricom chief executive Bob Collymore. By MAUREEN KAKAH 
Blogger Cyprian Nyakundi sentenced to four months imprisonment or ordered to pay a fine of Sh 300,000 for contempt of court by Lady Justice Njunguna. 
Mr Nyakundi was sentenced in a case he is accused of defaming Safaricom chief executive Bob Collymore. 
Mr Collymore sought orders to have Mr Nyakundi jailed for disobeying an injunction issued on July 18, 2016, blocking him from publishing defamatory articles concerning alleged corruption in the media industry in Kenya. 
Lady Justice had on December 02, 2016 ruled that the blogger had acted in contempt of court for publishing information about Mr Collymore despite temporary orders stopping him from the same. 
The dispute started way back in June when Mr Collymore and his predecessor Michael Joseph sued the blogger for publishing alleged defamatory statements about them. 
Lady Justice Njuguna issued temporary orders stopping Mr Nyakundi from making any further publications on his blog- cnyakundi.com about the two. 
But when he was summoned to appear in court in person to explain himself in person, he apologized for his behaviour while claiming that his posts were merely fair comments on a public interest matter. 
Despite this apology, he went ahead and published another article disparaging Mr Collymore. TALK TO US : Facebook || Twitter(@Nairobi_News) || Telegram: @nairobinews || Instagram: @nairobi_news || Snapchat: @nairobinews || Email: [email protected] || Phone: 0719 038 309
